storyInfo: Quercus returns to Caladon. Susie tips off the Guards, but finds herself kidnapped before escaping during an accidental explosion. Councilor Bishmer's conspiracy at last comes to light.

attributes.content: November 26th, 1097, 9:33 A.M.
Wasteland vagabond settlement, 40km out from Caladon City
The Druid of Gododdin stands upon the barrens, silent and sedate, before a low mound.
'He cheated death.'
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: 'Wrested its most ready of victories.'
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: 'He left with pride for the place of his eternal sleep.'
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: She calls out, waving her staff.
The sun rises. This is but one more ordinary burial in the wastelands of Terra.
Here's the wine we agreed on.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: It's not very strong, but don't drink too much.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: What about Mae's bottle?
attributes.name: Calm Wastelander

attributes.content: I want to pour it out here, where she's buried.
attributes.name: Calm Wastelander

attributes.content: *Sigh*... Even though Quercus went through all that trouble?
attributes.name: Depressed Wastelander

attributes.content: Don't worry about it. Let it return to the earth.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: You said you could brew it in three weeks... but never did we imagine that she wouldn't last that long.
attributes.name: Depressed Wastelander

attributes.content: *Sigh*... It's just the two of us now.
attributes.name: Depressed Wastelander

attributes.content: Alright, man, cheer up. Here's to Mae.
attributes.name: Calm Wastelander

attributes.content: To Mae...
attributes.name: Depressed Wastelander

attributes.content: Yeah, to Mae.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Security in Caladon has been tight as of late, Quercus. We couldn't go inside to find you.
attributes.name: Calm Wastelander

attributes.content: I know it wouldn't have helped. The disease we have is incurable, and it was her time to go.
attributes.name: Calm Wastelander

attributes.content: It's just... the way she cried those last couple of days. It was hard to watch.
attributes.name: Calm Wastelander

attributes.content: *Sigh*... You've sent so many of us on our way. You know how much it hurts.
attributes.name: Calm Wastelander

attributes.content: She begged me to put her out of her misery with my Arts, but I couldn't do it.
attributes.name: Calm Wastelander

attributes.content: Then... the next day, we found her at the bottom of the hill. She was asleep. Her eyes were closed. She didn't have to cry again.
attributes.name: Calm Wastelander

attributes.content: There wasn't anyone there. She didn't infect anyone, and she didn't bother any of us. Everything was fine. It was all good. I just thought it was...
attributes.name: Calm Wastelander

attributes.content: A little lonely, right?
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Yeah, lonely.
attributes.name: Calm Wastelander

attributes.content: Here, another round.
attributes.name: Calm Wastelander

attributes.content: Mmhmm.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Don't throw out the rest of the wine. Save it for the living.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Alright, if you say so.
attributes.name: Depressed Wastelander

attributes.content: Oh, right, the Catastrophe Messengerâ€”Miss Elba. She stopped by a few days ago. Here's a letter she wanted us to pass on to you.
attributes.name: Depressed Wastelander

attributes.content: A letter from Elba the 'Chaser?'
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Right, didn't you ask her to help you look into how the Duke's encampment is doing?
attributes.name: Depressed Wastelander

attributes.content: We've been seeing quite a few army convoys heading north the last couple days. Makes you wonder what those bigwigs in the city are up to.
attributes.name: Depressed Wastelander

attributes.content: Whatever it is, it's probably no good... Be absolutely careful.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Anyway, I need to head back now. Whatever happens, take care of yourself.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Here's some medicine for you. It's winter now, and it'll only get colder. If you get chilblains, use some of this.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: 'FrostNova'... What a funny name for an ointment.
attributes.name: Depressed Wastelander

attributes.content: When will we see you again, Quercus?
attributes.name: Calm Wastelander

attributes.content: Hmm... I'm not sure.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Alright, alright. I get it.
attributes.name: Calm Wastelander

attributes.content: If that's going to be difficult... mind if I ask you one last question?
attributes.name: Calm Wastelander

attributes.content: Ask me as many as you want. We still have plenty of wine.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Why are you helping us? The medicine's not cheap, right?
attributes.name: Calm Wastelander

attributes.content: You often come to us wastelanders for information. Who do you work for?
attributes.name: Calm Wastelander

attributes.content: We're just curious, we've known you so long... They say you probably used to be an officer in the military...
attributes.name: Calm Wastelander

attributes.content: Honestly, it doesn't much matter to us who you really are. We don't care for the righteousness of the city folks. You're helping us live longer, so we'll help you out, whatever it is you're doing.
attributes.name: Calm Wastelander

attributes.content: No, I want to tell you the truth, but I doubt you'll believe me.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: If I told you that there was a group of people who have been trying to save the Infected, would you believe me?
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: November 28th, 1097, 2:28 P.M.
So the Duke of Gododdin actually took his forces to Londinium?
attributes.name: Kite the Recorder

attributes.content: Yes, I'm sure of it.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: How big were his forces?
attributes.name: Kite the Recorder

attributes.content: The wastelanders saw at least two high-speed battleships sailing through. The Catastrophe Messenger also told me that she saw the siege troops leave their encampment too.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: That's bad news... All eight dukes are taking their forces to Londinium...
attributes.name: Kite the Recorder

attributes.content: Anyway, I'll fill Captain Root in on the news.
attributes.name: Kite the Recorder

attributes.content: Right, and I'm done with what Dr. Kal'tsit wanted me to take care of. Be extra careful with this document, please.
attributes.name: Kite the Recorder

attributes.content: Here are the nomadic platform entrance permits to four dukedoms, and this is Rhodes Island's business permit for operating in Victoria.
attributes.name: Kite the Recorder

attributes.content: 'Industrial Waste Recycling and Processing'.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Couldn't we have just told them our usual line of business?
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Victoria is especially strict with corporations that deal in Oripathy prevention, and each dukedom operates differently. It's too much of a hassle, so this is simpler. We need to get our foot in the door first.
attributes.name: Kite the Recorder

attributes.content: I see...
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Also, here's a letter from Lady Heidi. Make sure you hand it to Dr. Kal'tsit directly!
attributes.name: Kite the Recorder

attributes.content: Understood. Don't worry.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: I'll head back to the town archives now... My coworkers are going to get suspicious if I disappear for too long.
attributes.name: Kite the Recorder

attributes.content: Oh, right! There's one more thing I need to tell you.
attributes.name: Kite the Recorder

attributes.content: The place you were using as a hideout, the Green Spark. Someone burned it down a few days ago.
attributes.name: Kite the Recorder

attributes.content: What?!
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Captain Root's been waiting for you. You should head to the office soon.
attributes.name: Kite the Recorder

attributes.content: The shop was burned down? Why...?
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: November 28th, 1097, 3:15 P.M.
Captain, I'm back.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Oh, nice work out there, Quercus.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: 'Captain'?!
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Susie!
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Quercus, Mr. Root was your... captain?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: So this is where you were... I was so worried.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: You've been working for Rhodes Island...?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Hahaha... I... I'll tell you everything later.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: But perfect timing, Quercus. We have a severely infected patient in here.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: How are they?
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: She's having an acute attack. Luckily, Susie got her to us in time.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: We're finished with the basic precautions. I'll leave the rest to you.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: Okay, let's see.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Hand me the testing reagent.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Here.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: She's too weak. We need to give her an IV...
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Quercus...
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Hm?
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Can you cure Oripathy?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: No, I can't, and no one can. But Rhodes Island developed some medicine that can at least stabilize her condition and prevent it from worsening.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: She's very sick... but please. Don't give up on her.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Is she your friend?
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: No, never mind. Everyone here in the Infected community is your friend.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Don't worry. She'll make it after she gets this shot. Her fever's caused by the inflammation, and I can control that with Originium Arts. That'll keep it from worsening down the road, and should help stabilize her.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: She also had some scrapes on her, which I took care of. She won't be in pain anymore.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Okay...
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: A-Are you alright?
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Quercus... Green Spark is gone... All gone.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: I know... *sigh*...
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: I was just about to ask you.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: I haven't heard anything on my end, but do you have any ideas? Made any enemies?
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: Me? Enemies? No chance here. And Susie definitely wouldn't.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: There's been a lot going on in the city lately. The timing is uncanny. I couldn't help but wonder how everything's connected.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: A couple days ago, someone tried to kidnap a city councilor in the Infected community.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: Who could be so bold?
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Luckily, Skyfire was there, so things didn't take a turn for the worse.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: Now the Guards are all clamoring that there are criminals here in the community, though they haven't done any additional investigations either.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: I saw on my way here. They posted notices and wanted posters everywhere. They're even giving out rewards for tips.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Bounties for suspicious people in the Infected community too... You have to hand it to them.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: So you owned the shop... that they burned down...
attributes.name: Haze

attributes.content: Miss Haze!
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Oh, she's awake.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Where am I...? Am I alive? Or is this what the afterlife looks like?
attributes.name: Haze

attributes.content: Yeah, you're alive.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: This is a Rhodes Island office... They're the ones who saved you.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Rhodes Island... I didn't expect they'd actually help the Infected...
attributes.name: Haze

attributes.content: You said 'they' burned down the shop... What do you mean?
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: I was being hunted by two thugs that night, and hid inside a place called the Green Spark. Didn't expect them to toss in a firebomb though.
attributes.name: Haze

attributes.content: A firebomb?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Someone was hunting you down? Why?!
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: No clue. Maybe because I overheard them talking about kidnapping some 'old councilor fart' and something about bombs? They probably wanted to silence me.
attributes.name: Haze

attributes.content: Wait! Back up!
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: They were going to kidnap a councilor? When was this?
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: And what's this about bombs?
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: How... How many days was I out?
attributes.name: Haze

attributes.content: Today's November 28th, Miss Haze.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: So it was five nights ago... on the night of the 23rd.
attributes.name: Haze

attributes.content: The day before they took those people to the factory...
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: If you don't mind, could you tell me where you ran into those two thugs?
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: Some ten minutes later.
This location on the map... Here, right?
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: That's right.
attributes.name: Haze

attributes.content: The buildings here have been left empty because of how close they are to the abandoned district.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: Sounds like the perfect place to hatch a scheme.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Two Siracusans... Must be immigrants from there.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: And I doubt they're Infected if they didn't think twice before setting fire to a building in the community.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: Most likely mercenaries, or thugs working for the mafia.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: If we know where they are, shouldn't we go pay them a visit?
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: I'd recommend against that.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: This is well beyond Rhodes Island's usual scope of business. We aren't here to keep the peace.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: That's true...
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: But now that the Guards have a bounty out on them, we might just get a reward for turning over this information.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: It's not much, but it'll help pay for Miss Susie's losses.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: Right!
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Huh? Is that okay, really? Shouldn't Miss Haze get the reward?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Let's just call it my way of paying you back... for saving my life.
attributes.name: Haze

attributes.content: I was the whole reason your shop got burned down in the first place...
attributes.name: Haze

attributes.content: Oh... It's not your fault. If you'd hid anywhere else, they would've burned down someone else's house instead.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Besides, the one who saved you was an Infected worker named Red.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: I don't think it's such a bad idea. Helping those two bastards get caught will blow off some steam, at least.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Thanks, Miss Haze... Quercus...
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Huh? Don't rub my ears...
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Why are you being so polite with me now?
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: It's settled, then. I'll help you put a report together, Miss Susie. You just need to take it down to the Guard station.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: Right.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: What are you looking at?
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: There's a kitten across the street, sunbathing against the wall.
attributes.name: Haze

attributes.content: Are you jealous?
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: Of course.
attributes.name: Haze

attributes.content: Oh... they broke a flower pot... ran away, too.
attributes.name: Haze

attributes.content: I'm wondering. When will you chase me out of here?
attributes.name: Haze

attributes.content: Once Rhodes Island accepts an patient who's having an acute Oripathy attack, we won't let them leave until their condition stabilizes.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: I can't pay for treatment, you know?
attributes.name: Haze

attributes.content: No need to worry.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Of course, there are options available if you want to continue your treatment afterwards. I'll fill you in on the details once you get better.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: By the way...
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: If there's anything you want to discuss, you're free to talk to me about it.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: My little 'Big Hat of the Witch Forest.'
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: You...
attributes.name: Haze

attributes.content: I never expected to meet a survivor of the Witch Forest.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: The Witch Forest? You mean the organization that took in Infected Casters?
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: That's them.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: If I remember correctly, five years ago, they refused to cooperate with the Duke, and so the Victorian Army...
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Can we... talk about something else?
attributes.name: Haze

attributes.content: Oh, I'm sorry. I didn't mean to...
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: No need to apologize~
attributes.name: Haze

attributes.content: I made my peace with that a long time ago. I was even prepared to, well, bite the dust in this city.
attributes.name: Haze

attributes.content: Though, sometimes, I still do want to put up a fight. See more kittens.
attributes.name: Haze

attributes.content: Now that I think about it, if I didn't hide inside Susie's shop that night, those Siracusans wouldn't have burned her shop down.
attributes.name: Haze

attributes.content: Quercus? Are you back?
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Good morning. What's wrong? You look exhausted.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: From the looks of it, the investigation was a success?
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: Those Guards are absolutely hopeless cases! How could they wash their hands of it after putting up all those wanted posters?! Are they just waiting for the suspects to turn themselves in?!
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: And where did Grani go? I was hoping to ask her to look into the factory...
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: You'd better not count on Grani too much. Her status as a collaborating operator of Rhodes Island puts her in quite a tricky position.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Strange...
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: What's the matter?
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: I didn't notice until just now, but the building where Miss Haze ran into those Siracusan thugs... is right next to the factory.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: Huh? You're right!
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Miss Haze, you said they used military-grade incendiaries to burn down Susie's shop, right?
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: That's right!
attributes.name: Haze

attributes.content: Is something wrong?
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: If I remember correctly, the factory is owned by Councilor Bishmer. They make military-grade weapons there, and it was shut down a month and a half ago for 'equipment maintenance'.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: But the factory was completely empty when I got kidnapped by those fake Infected! Did someone steal their equipment?
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: The papers certainly haven't reported on anything like that.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Are you telling me... the thugs are working with Councilor Bishmer?
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: We don't have enough evidence. It's too soon to make that conclusion...
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: But... unless I'm mistaken...
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: The Caladonian Guards' Captain is Bishmer's nephew.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: Right. I think I heard that from Grani before.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Susie... How long has it been since Susie went to the Guards?
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: About three hours. She should've been back by now.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: I'll go find her!
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: I'm going too!
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Bring your comms! Stay in touch.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: This is getting out of hand.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: The calm Rhodes Island Operator takes a close look at the maps on his desk and sorts out the many doubts in his mind.
Then, he takes out an oddly-shaped communicator from his desk.
What are you doing, Captain?! I'm at work right now! Do you know how many people there are at the town archives?!
Kazemaru, this is extremely urgent. Prioritize what I'm about to ask of you.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: ...Understood.

I want you to put together a list of addresses of the properties owned by Count Bishmer, as well as a diagram of the old underground logistics passages beneath the city. As detailed and as quickly as possible.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: Got it. I'll take care of it right now.
Did you find her?
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: No! The Guards said their captain went to the location with Susie, and they haven't come back yet!
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Dammit!
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Calm down. Think of where she could've been taken.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: I'm thinking...
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Captain?
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Captain Root! What's going on?
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Listen carefully. I've just compared where Count Bishmer's estate intersects with Caladon's old logistics channels.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: I've worked out the seven most likely tunnel entrances.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: You think they took Susie underground?
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: As long as he's not an idiot, Bishmer's sure to imagine Susie has people helping her out, so he's not guaranteed to silence her.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: They'll take her to where it's quietest, and least likely to be found.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: There's also a chance they're in the abandoned sectors, but earlier I found out the biggest of the tunnels runs under his factory, which explains where all the equipment disappeared to too.
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: You two get going for now! If anything happens, I'll get in touch!
attributes.name: Bitter Root

attributes.content: Alright!
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Now what?
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: How about I sweep the south three entrances, and you handle the north four.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Not a problem.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Stay safe!
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: You too!
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: November 28th, 1097, 8:30 P.M.
Susie opens her eyes, and realizes she's laid right on top of the ice-cold pavement.
The damp chilly air pervades all throughout the gloom of the vacant space.
A faint pain in the back of her head still hasn't left her.
To one side of her comes the sound of a quarrel.
You lot are a bunch of useless nothings! How can you twist something as sure as this so badly?
attributes.name: Bishmer

attributes.content: It's... I didn't imagine... we'd hit all these setbacks.
attributes.name: Guards

attributes.content: Why did that decrepit lizard Angst suddenly send a Caster to his event? Did you let the information leak?
attributes.name: Bishmer

attributes.content: One of us has been causing constant commotion, I admit that.
attributes.name: Guards

attributes.content: But... Councilor Angst had an honest flare-up of heart disease...
attributes.name: Guards

attributes.content: And that just HAPPENS?
attributes.name: Bishmer

attributes.content: Where... is this...?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: (Wha..! My hands! Why are they tied together...?)
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: All these machines... is this the factory?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: No... it isn't, are these... the abandoned logistics tunnels?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: What's even going on...?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: I remember the Guards' Captain said he'd see the place with me...
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: And then...
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: My head's killing me...
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: We're in a fine state now. How am I meant to file for losses with the factory not blown up? Hm?
attributes.name: Bishmer

attributes.content: Then... maybe you could say a thief stole all the equipment...?
attributes.name: Guards

attributes.content: Only imbeciles like you would believe that!
attributes.name: Bishmer

attributes.content: An entire factory's facilities made off with overnight! That could only be the work of a traitor! Anyone would jump to suspecting me!
attributes.name: Bishmer

attributes.content: And they'd be sure to come searching this way, with a theft on that grand a scale!
attributes.name: Bishmer

attributes.content: Once the Duke's people find everything right here, it'll all be over!
attributes.name: Bishmer

attributes.content: Justâ€”hold on, you never even once told me why blowing up your own factory would solve things.
attributes.name: Guards

attributes.content: Is THAT too hard for you? When the City Council asks me where all the money they gave me went, I'd just say I bought the facilities, but then the Infected blew them up!
attributes.name: Bishmer

attributes.content: After that, we make up the cash, and so be it if the factory's kaput because it wasn't mine anyhow! So long as I've got all this costly industrial equipment, everything is fine!
attributes.name: Bishmer

attributes.content: But now it's not! It's all a wash!
attributes.name: Bishmer

attributes.content: *Sigh*... What do we do about this, then?
attributes.name: Guards

attributes.content: What else?! Get to work quick, get all these things moved out of the city! We can't leave any evidence behind!
attributes.name: Bishmer

attributes.content: Couldn't we just move it back...?
attributes.name: Guards

attributes.content: Think for one second! The entire Infected community has their eyes on us after that business! In what world do you just MOVE IT BACK?!
attributes.name: Bishmer

attributes.content: The Guards'... Captain? Councilor Bishmer?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Oh! You're awake now?
attributes.name: Guards

attributes.content: Our kind Infected citizen.
attributes.name: Guards

attributes.content: You've given me no end of trouble!
attributes.name: Guards

attributes.content: Wh... Why...?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Don't act stupid! Now confess, who told you everything you told me earlier?
attributes.name: Guards

attributes.content: Who are all these... accomplices of yours?
attributes.name: Guards

attributes.content: ...So you... you were their...
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Listen up, I'm asking you! Who told you about those two Siracusans?
attributes.name: Guards

attributes.content: And who's this 'reliable witness' in this report of yours? Tell me their name!
attributes.name: Guards

attributes.content: Speak!
attributes.name: Guards

attributes.content: (She glares furiously at him.)
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: You think you can give me LOOKS?
attributes.name: Guards

attributes.content: Ungh...
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Never mind that, it means nothing whether she talks. There's no time to waste. Get this place sorted out.
attributes.name: Bishmer

attributes.content: But the problem is the people she has with her!
attributes.name: Guards

attributes.content: Hardly anyone can testify against us. We'll be fine once the Danton brothers get out of this city and never come back.
attributes.name: Bishmer

attributes.content: What's important right now is how you stop up the cash deficit.
attributes.name: Bishmer

attributes.content: And by the way, don't be violent in front of me. I get sick at the sight of blood. Drag her off elsewhere.
attributes.name: Bishmer

attributes.content: Not a problem.
attributes.name: Guards

attributes.content: November 28th, 1097, 8:32 P.M.
It's hard to believe this is the place...
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: It's too late to call for help now, with two dozen people here...
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Forget it. Let's do this.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: The Druid of Gododdin sprinkles a scattering of unusual seeds across the bare earth.
Her staff lets out a green radiance, and under the effect of her Originium Arts, the seeds rapidly bud, digging into the ground.
Hey, you, Feline! What are you doing?
attributes.name: Hooligan Mercenary

attributes.content: Ooh, you've got fine eyesight.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: What's someone ordinary doing down here?
attributes.name: Boil Brawler

attributes.content: I'm in a hurry. Just come at once, everyone.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: You're daft! Are you looking for a fight?
attributes.name: Hooligan Mercenary

attributes.content: Massive vines, each at least as thick as a hand, shoot out from the ground and knock the ruffians to the floor.
From the ground, from the walls, from the supports, green vegetation sprawls wantonly.
The fallen mercenaries are quickly bound tight by plants, with not even a moment to shout.
Are your salaries worth continuing this fight?
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Or will you make way and let me through?
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: ...You go on ahead, Miss. I never saw anything today.
attributes.name: Boil Brawler

attributes.content: Out, out! We're off the clock now!
attributes.name: Boil Brawler

attributes.content: That's more like it.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: So it was... all of you who burned down my shop?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Enough rubbish from you. Keep walking.
attributes.name: Guards

attributes.content: For crying out loud, don't blame me. If anyone, blame yourself, for being so starved for a hobby you got yourself meddling in all this.
attributes.name: Guards

attributes.content: But you Infected were never bound to live long anyway, so this'll do.
attributes.name: Guards

attributes.content: ...You... You'll be paying for this.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: For being at death's door, you've got some bluster.
attributes.name: Guards

attributes.content: (She shuts her eyes.)
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: W-Why is the ground shaking?
attributes.name: Guards

attributes.content: What's happening? Is there an earthquake? What sound is that?!
attributes.name: Bishmer

attributes.content: Wait... It's coming from above.
attributes.name: Hooligan Mercenary

attributes.content: The fierce sound of an explosion arrives from overhead, the structural layer shaking across the entire abandoned sector.
The walls crack, and the rocking intensifies.
Immediately after, the explosion gives way to the rumble of the tunnel's collapse. Together with the tremors, the unbroken sounds of structures bursting draw closer and closer.
What the hell was that?!
attributes.name: Guards

attributes.content: Aaaaargh!!
attributes.name: Guards

attributes.content: Engulfed in the explosion's roar, the top layer of the subterranean structure collapses, dropping several tons of steel frame directly upon the head of the Guards' Captain.
The rumbling persists as concrete and steel supports rupture and subside, the whole structural layer thrown into chaos.
Huh? Wh-Whaa?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: (I... I need to run!)
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Run!! It's going to sink!
attributes.name: Hooligan Mercenary

attributes.content: What on Terra?! The goods! The facilities, they've all been crushed!
attributes.name: Bishmer

attributes.content: Save your skin first, sir! Get out of here!
attributes.name: Hooligan Mercenary

attributes.content: What's the cause of this? Is there a Catastrophe?!
attributes.name: Bishmer

attributes.content: There's no end to the rotten luck today, I see! Blasted, damned...!
attributes.name: Bishmer

attributes.content: Just leave it for now. Come on, sir, let's move!
attributes.name: Hooligan Mercenary

attributes.content: That Infected! She's escaped!
attributes.name: Bishmer

attributes.content: Which of you was it who bound her?
attributes.name: Bishmer

attributes.content: We can't let her flee! After her, all of you!
attributes.name: Bishmer

attributes.content: You really can run, you little bastard.
attributes.name: Boil Brawler

attributes.content: If it wasn't for you, we wouldn't be in this mess.
attributes.name: Boil Brawler

attributes.content: (Raises weapon)
attributes.name: Boil Brawler

attributes.content: A keen blade pierces out from the shadows. A simple yet powerful cutting blow. The ruffian falls to the floor in response.
There's more?!
attributes.name: Hooligan Mercenary

attributes.content: Get running, Miss Susie!
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: M... Mr. Red? What are you...
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Don't mind for now. Move, fast.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: A... Alright!
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: What are you standing there for?! After them!
attributes.name: Guards Member

attributes.content: Still? We don't even know where the Count's gone!
attributes.name: Hooligan Mercenary

attributes.content: Then don't go. I'll be happy to take your pay.
attributes.name: Guards Member

attributes.content: Dream on.
attributes.name: Hooligan Mercenary

attributes.content: It's... It's a dead end now.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Before Susie's eyes, the firm alloy platform hangs fractured from the explosion. A broken bridge, at least a four meter jump, is seemingly the only way out.
Behind them, the voices of the ruffians and mercenaries cursing draw ever closer.
Now what...?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: These people love their work too much. Following us in these conditions...?
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: You've really got a knack for inviting trouble, Miss Susie.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: Mr. Red, what are you doing here? And do you usually carry that blade?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: I'll explain later when we get the chance.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: Right now, I need to find a way to get you out of here.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: There's no shortage of people in the Infected community worrying about you.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: But right now...
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Sorry about this, Miss Susie.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: The Infected worker lifts her up and tosses her over, like slinging a crate of goods.
The young Feline draws a clean arc through the air, and lands on the platform's other side.
...Ow, ow, ow... Mr. Red?!
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Keep running upwards! Quick!
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: What about you?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Hurry!
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: The collapsing framework fully blocks off the entrance of the tunnel as the figure of the Infected worker vanishes into its shadows without a trace.
Mr. Red...
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: ...I can't stop here, I need to get out...
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: (Did the earthquake... stop?)
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: (What even happened outside?)
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: (Mr. Red... Is he still okay?)
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: ...There's no way on. It's blocked.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: How far away... is the surface still?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Finally... argh, my giddy aunt...
attributes.name: Bishmer

attributes.content: Oh, my back... good grief...
attributes.name: Bishmer

attributes.content: ...It's you.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Brilliant. You made it out of there somehow, you Infected wretch.
attributes.name: Bishmer

attributes.content: Bastard, bloody scum of the earth, useless good-for-nothing.
attributes.name: Bishmer

attributes.content: It's all your fault!
attributes.name: Bishmer

attributes.content: It's all you blasted Infected vermin... My money!
attributes.name: Bishmer

attributes.content: Get out of my damned way.
attributes.name: Bishmer

attributes.content: A slap from the greedy politician hits Susie square in the face, all his anger taken out at once on the Feline girl.
However, the Infected in front of him shows no sign of cowering in response to the savage act.
She stares down the noble before her, the stifled depression and pain she had experienced for days on end now nowhere to be seen.
That's the reason?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Your people burned down my shop for something like this.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: You'd go this far, hurt so many Infected, for something like this.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: All just for... money?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: She slowly stands back up, no longer the timid Feline from before.
In this moment, only enmity and anger remain in her gaze.
Every last thing that happened these past few days, all because of the greedy politician before her.
Why should he not pay the price?
All of this was so far overboard... just for money?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: What are you doing?! Don't come near!
attributes.name: Bishmer

attributes.content: Keep away from me! Youâ€”monster, get out!
attributes.name: Bishmer

attributes.content: ...I can't forgive you.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: She shivers, electric sparks jumping about her whole body.
You... someone... save me!
attributes.name: Bishmer

attributes.content: You... infernal...
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: The young Feline clasps fast the councilor's neck, violent sparks crackling.
Aaaaagh!!! Help me! Aaghhh!
attributes.name: Bishmer

attributes.content: Now you're frightened! Now you're scared!
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Spare me! I beg of you... don't kill me... aaaaghggghhh!!!
attributes.name: Bishmer

attributes.content: Whatever you want... I'll give you... aaaghh!
attributes.name: Bishmer

attributes.content: Spare me! Just spare me!
attributes.name: Bishmer

attributes.content: What gives you the right... to destroy my lifeâ€”what gives you the right...
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: You... you...
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: The young Feline lets her unrestrained anger loose. Councilor Bishmer twitches and spasms under her Originium Arts, frothing at the mouth and gasping what could be his last gasps.
Urkh...
attributes.name: Bishmer

attributes.content: Behind her, massive vines suddenly surge out past fragments of concrete, their roots bracing the steel frames. The city's lights shine down through an opening, illuminating a silhouette.
Susie! Susie! Stop it!
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: The Druid of Gododdin hurries to embrace the Infected before her. The fierce sparks burn her skin, but still she holds on.
Calm down, Susie... it's me, it's over now...
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: ...Qu... Quercus...
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: It's alright, Susie, everything's over.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: People like that... aren't worth what you're doing. Let's go home.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Quercus... *sob*...
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: It's alright, it's alright now. I'm here.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Home... the Green Spark's... gone... go home where...?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Don't fret. Do you remember what I always say?
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: 'Life always finds a place where it belongs.'
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Let's go, little Susie. It's time to go home.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Quercus... I... I...
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Ungh...
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: In the narrow interstice between soil and stone, lattices of steel, and constructs of forsaken material, a young Feline lets out a deep, low wail, a weight fallen from her back.
November 30th, 1097, 7:45 A.M.
Professor, I'm here.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Ah, good morning, Miss Mountbelan.
attributes.name: Councilor Angst

attributes.content: Ah, no, you're 'Operator Skyfire' now, I presume?
attributes.name: Councilor Angst

attributes.content: Good enough spirits to crack a joke, I see.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Here, turn that frown upside-down! I'm quite alright.
attributes.name: Councilor Angst

attributes.content: You're in the hospital! I wouldn't call that alright!
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Speaking of which, how did everything shake out in the end?
attributes.name: Councilor Angst

attributes.content: The City Council passed your proposal, even if you only gained a single supporter.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: That's worth celebrating, Miss Mountbelan.
attributes.name: Councilor Angst

attributes.content: Is it really, Professor?
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: There's still old nobility against the Infected community, and they've all ganged up in private. The clashing's only going to worsen from now on.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Now they're just waiting for Duke Gododdin to come back. They've signed a joint letter asking the Duke to abolish your title and strip you of your noble status.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: It's VERY stacked against you.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Hahahaha...
attributes.name: Councilor Angst

attributes.content: I'm already a good 153 years old, Miss Mountbelan.
attributes.name: Councilor Angst

attributes.content: I'm looking to retire next year, retreat to my little castle, and take up a bit of my studies.
attributes.name: Councilor Angst

attributes.content: Titles, status, authority.
attributes.name: Councilor Angst

attributes.content: Do you think any of that still concerns me?
attributes.name: Councilor Angst

attributes.content: If things proceed without much hiccup, you'll be back at Rhodes Island too, won't you? Send Dame Kal'tsit my regards.
attributes.name: Councilor Angst

attributes.content: I will...
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: I'm just worried for you somewhat, Professor.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Now, now, what's to worry for? Look at my rickety old body.
attributes.name: Councilor Angst

attributes.content: I tell you, some things people go and say are all but pompous and, well, completely meaningless excuses.
attributes.name: Councilor Angst

attributes.content: People are already too accustomed to lying with pretentious jargon. So the lies pile up, and as lofty as it was meant to be, the principle gets washed out in the process.
attributes.name: Councilor Angst

attributes.content: Miss Mountbelan, do you know why I pushed for that proposal for Caladon so?
attributes.name: Councilor Angst

attributes.content: You mean, the reason all that pretention sticks around?
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Twenty years ago, a scientist named Janet Longfellow published an essay.
attributes.name: Councilor Angst

attributes.content: She set forth this view: if we don't streamline and improve on our current Originium industry and its waste products, then the year-on-year buildup of industrial waste may bring about frightening consequences.
attributes.name: Councilor Angst

attributes.content: At the time, Victoria's academic circles all turned their noses up at that, and the nobles wielded public opinion to unabashedly ridicule this fine scientist. In her anger, she left Victoria altogether.
attributes.name: Councilor Angst

attributes.content: But in the last ten years, the amount of Infected in Victoria has accelerated at a worrying rate.
attributes.name: Councilor Angst

attributes.content: Times have changed, Miss Mountbelan. We have to face the issues that 'Oripathy' and the 'Infected' bring. Maintaining this status quo will only worsen things.
attributes.name: Councilor Angst

attributes.content: 153 years, Miss Mountbelan. It's not common to see people live as long as I do, even among Savra.
attributes.name: Councilor Angst

attributes.content: But a long life's a good thing. It gives you the chance to see firsthand the folds and changes of history, to learn from your mistakes.
attributes.name: Councilor Angst

attributes.content: In my century and a half, I've witnessed the toppling of Gaul's majestic palace, the fall of Iberia's golden city.
attributes.name: Councilor Angst

attributes.content: In the plains of Columbia, I saw for myself the destruction the Grand Duke's army wrought on the frontier territories. I saw the Columbians in their sharp, steep ascent over the wastes.
attributes.name: Councilor Angst

attributes.content: If Victoria can't change, then in the end, it'll only be another Gaul.
attributes.name: Councilor Angst

attributes.content: It's just as I've told you, Miss Mountbelan.
attributes.name: Councilor Angst

attributes.content: Times have changed.
attributes.name: Councilor Angst

attributes.content: You're back? I thought the Guards would've been slower than that.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Oh, no, if it isn't our honorary citizen, star of all the front pages.
attributes.name: Haze

attributes.content: Your picture was very decent in the paper. Who knew you could be so photogenic, Susie?
attributes.name: Haze

attributes.content: Was it very heavy, that meter-wide certificate saying you've the lay of the land? Did you get tired lifting it for the cameras?
attributes.name: Haze

attributes.content: Come on, stop being sarcastic with her.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: 'The City's Hero' though... that's pretty impressive, isn't it!
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: What about that awful councilor, in the end?
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Taken into custody!
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Are the Guards still acting as normal, after such a big blunder?
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: It's not that easy, obviously, but we'll have someone from the Mounted Police taking over the Guards soon.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: That sounds good, I'd think.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Shame we've still got no way to make up for li'l Susie's losses... Bishmer's assets all got seized by the City Council.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Do you want a sweet? I've still got plenty of flavors here you haven't tried before!
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Will the council really not give you a single penny? Nothing except a certificate? Oh, forget it, they've always been this way.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Come here, perk yourself up a little with something sugary. Your artifact smile on that photo looked like you could cry.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: ...Thanks.
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: I... I don't even know what to do at this point, really...
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Think on the bright side! At least those evildoers are brought to justice now.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: I'll admit, I still feel so many problems are waiting to be solved... but this is as far as we're able to intervene.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Quercus, are you leaving?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Mm. I'll be back in Victoria very soon, however.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Will you come back to Caladon?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: More someplace in the wastes than a nomadic city, I think.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: That's right, Susie, have you ever thought of bartending somewhere else?
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: You see, the Green Spark may be gone now... but there's still plenty of Infected who'll need a drink.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: You could hairdress too. I know a lot of people who do nothing but get into fights. Some of them have never been to nomadic cities before. Some of them never think about themselves.
attributes.name: Quercus

attributes.content: Eh? Could I really?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: Of course you could! There's all sorts of interesting people aboard Rhodes Island. You might as well go take a look, and not too many people are specialty hairdressers there in the first place.
attributes.name: Grani

attributes.content: Hahaha... I'll give it a try?
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: (Everyone's been talking about Rhodes Island... What kind of place is it, I wonder?)
attributes.name: Susie

attributes.content: November 28th, 1097, 10:24 P.M.
Underground logistics passages of Caladon
Carry on, then. You were all mighty a moment ago, weren't you?
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: You! Who the hell are you?!
attributes.name: Boil Brawler

attributes.content: My name's Red. Remember it.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: Who gives a toss about your bloody name? Get out of my way, or I'm going to be pissed!
attributes.name: Hooligan Mercenary

attributes.content: You know, back in my Ursus days, they all called me 'Redblade'.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: You might want to guess why.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: Stay cool, boys! We're not easy to bring down either!
attributes.name: Hooligan Mercenary

attributes.content: That's right, he's all alone! It's just Originium bloody Arts!
attributes.name: Boil Brawler

attributes.content: He's far from alone.
What?! Where did you lot sneak out from?!
attributes.name: Boil Brawler

attributes.content: Now there's a nice reaction. You sure don't act like this when you're shoving the Infected about.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: Come on. Show me if you're really as mighty as you say.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: The blade in the Infected's hands is ignited in a blink, surrounded by blazing embers.
The red-hot glow illuminates the rubble; the stone and steel ruins are bathed in the clear hue of fire.
And its source, the youngster bearing the searing blade, begins his attack.
